course.subject: LANG
course.name: English for University Studies II
course.description: The course builds on LANG 1002 and aims to further develop students' proficiency in English as well as their academic literacy skills, so that they can cope with the linguistic demands of studying through the medium of English. The course aims to develop students' competence in reading and writing, as well as the ability to engage in oral interaction in social and academic contexts. For students under the four-year degree curriculum.
course.exclusions: IELTS - Band 7 or above in overall and Band 6.5 or above in each part of the test or equivalent

reviews.author: SmokingPuddle58
reviews.title: If you can, make your LANG1003 grade a T. (SmokingPuddle58, 2022)
reviews.comment_content:
ContentsğŸ¤”

No contents, you just make some useless discussion, useless perusall, useless videos, academic blogs and 2 electives, and the most important, the reflection, in which you cannot say anything bad about this course. Only appreciation. Hmm... GOOD!

Anyway, if there is no change for the syllabus of this course next year, go ahead and take IELTS exam or get a better results in public exam and do a credit-transfer for LANG1002 and 1003. Don't let this course occupy your times, in which you can do other things. This course doesn't relate to English much.

I miss the time, when LANG1002 is not hell, and when there are F2F lessons, every lesson is funnyğŸ˜¢.
reviews.comment_teaching: Sumie is a good instructor. She does not force you to open the camera and will sometimes delay the deadline of the SDLs. The bad is belonged to this course design, but not the instructor.
reviews.comment_grading:
No gradings are out yet, but I will update that soon!

===Updated 10/5/2022===
My instructor mentioned that she cannot guarantee our letter grades as it is considered as a brand new course, so she don't know the deviations and the conversion scales. But who knows â•®(â•¯â–½â•°)â•­   Just wait for the final letter grade out!

===Updated 8/6/2022===
Letter grades are out, I got a B- from Sumie (Or CLE department). It's 1 sub-grade lower than 1002S. Hmm, luckily no C-range. The LANG 100xS series course has ended. However, the nightmare has not yet come to the end. In the following semesters, CLE department and their staffs will try to bombard my TGA and CGA with their useless LANG courses. Stay tuned!
reviews.comment_workload:
Great! Talking about the workload, it's as great as a 4-credit course. Just like the combination of 2 course: Academic English (LANG-series) with 3 credit and video production (COMP-1xxx series) with 1 credit. Please remember to use APA-styled citation in your academic blog and video! (SmokingPuddle58, 2022)

reviews.author: Moooooon
reviews.comment_content:
They changed the syllabus this year and it is terrible as hell!

For Academic blog 2,
it requires
-short summary of 2 articles
-evaluate the 2 articles
-synthesis of 2 articles
-multimodal elements
-strictly follow APA style citation

But the word limit is 400 words only !!!!!!
Therefore I need to reduce the content in the evaluation part and get a 2.5/5 in the CA part.

You may see lots of comments about this course on Goop, none of them, including me satisfied:-I
reviews.comment_teaching:
Quite good. Try to engage students in the class
At least he( Martin T. C.) gave me comments and suggestions.
reviews.comment_grading:
I have gotten low marks in both academic blogs already.

Most sub-grades of the tasks are 3 out of 5. Therefore, B-.

From what other people comment on the grading, it depends on the instructor and that's true. In my session, the mean for some assignments can be 2.5 out of 5. However, I have heard some comments that some instructors always give out 4 out of 5.

Btw, it is good if you can enroll in the same session with your friend. The multimodal project is totally shit and doing it with friends can be an advantage to your peer evaluation and division of work.
reviews.comment_workload:
The highest workload among all the courses I have enrolled in!!!

1. Full of SDL which takes you >an hour
2. Boring Perusall (reading material that you need to make comment on it)
3. two academic blogs without clear guidelines
4. 6 minutes multimodal video ( you may need to take extra time to learn to edit the video)
5. introduction and wrap up for the video ( you need to prepare for that)
6. three reflection tasks (300 words *2 + 3mins speaking)
7. 2 electives

reviews.comment_content:

reviews.comment_teaching: Generally easy to understand but sometimes the instruction is not clear enough. You need to turn on your camera during the whole lesson. You cannot be late more than ~5mins because she would record your attendance.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is generally fair. However, the grading scheme of the two academic blogs is unclear and I get a poor grade.
You need to participate in 80% of the lessons to pass the attendance score.
reviews.comment_workload: There are so many works that are in part meaningless including Video Making Group Project, Perusall Assignments, SDL Tasks, Academic blog etc... The marking scheme of some of the tasks is unclear. A very terrible syllabus in my opinion.

reviews.author: nobodyhaha
reviews.title: leng grade!!! Not killer
reviews.comment_content:
beauty and happiness, many breakout room activities for writing and speaking practices. Reading materials are provided as reference during class time / on canvas. It is quite hard when you group with boys as they are too quiet, dead air for so many times haha but luckily my groupmates all girls in elpa speaking assessment! Role-playing like devil advocate is interesting to put theory into practice.

Reading Paper & Writing Paper: 80 minutes
Speaking Test: 5 minutes an adapted version of Part 1: only Question 2 (compare and contrast) & Question 3 (giving opinions), and
Part 2 (suggesting solutions).

Elpa(online this year) is a closed book exam just dun rely on other source. Speaking(modified version so only type 2 &3 compare contrast/ opinion) : 1 min impromptu speech+ 1 mins immediate response +2mins short speaking(1 mins prep time), just like DSE for the 1 min part. Word limit of writing is 300 words and pretty straightforward, no need to revise a lot for elpa if you listen to Rosita's instructions. I didn't use complicate words neither for my speaking nor writing but the fluency and variation matter.
reviews.comment_teaching: passionate teacher, Rosita is well-prepared and try to make our class engaging, if you pay attention in class like remarks for essay citation, punctation and try to use some skills taught in class, then you will be alright. Just follow the steps she requires/expects you to do in your essay like TS->primary explanation->citation  -> secondary explanation -> sc to organise your essay in a systematic way.
reviews.comment_grading: Fair enough, don't be scared, it is not that bad. No idea abt my elpa, just have my elpa reading: 18/26 and essay marks, 4545(1) so it is out of my surprise that I have A-!!! :O I attend every lecture so put your best foot forward, no sweat abt your grade. Elpa is similar to ielts I guess. Good luck and hope you all enjoy Rosita's class! She is a good tutor.
reviews.comment_workload: 1 essay, 1 voc learning(12 practice tests by using VOLT+reflection) and 1 elpa test (online mode this year so no listening) Attendance only count for the first time so I am not sure whether attendance is influential or not but make sure no abs more than 6 times. For me the breakout room activities are the most intensive part but not that chur if considering assessments.

reviews.comment_teaching: Excellent Teaching. Passionate attitude. She's definitely a kind and responsible tutor.

reviews.author: B.T.
reviews.title: Good Tutor
reviews.comment_content: Typical LANG1003, nothing special, contents are unuseful at all in my opinion.
reviews.comment_teaching:
He asked questions very frequently, be prepared to be called and answer him. It is definitely okay if you don't know the answer, he would surely help you out and let you feel less embarrassed. In most of the cases, my class as a whole are quite introverted and refuse to answer even when called, and this is no good because you are making him become embarrassed. Try generating something from your mind, no pressure!

He is not super hilarious and might get boring in some means, but this is not his fault because LANG course is generally not interesting. However, he is super helpful in all graded tasks, he would give mock vocab test, a lot of samples on thesis and thesis statement, and talking about our topics' feasibility to us one by one before we did our graded writing task.
reviews.comment_grading:
His grading is good!!!

He may give lower marks for graded tasks in general, but on the other hand, he gave good grades. Even you get many 4 and some 5 in all graded tasks and ELPA, you may still be able to get an A-range or a B+

It is much better than some killers who grant many 6 in graded tasks and resulted in a C-range at last.
reviews.comment_workload: In occasions, he may ask us to do some out-of-class work, but they are neither graded nor checked, they are just for your own good after all. If you just don't have time, then leave them is fine.

reviews.comment_workload:
Horrible.
Its workload is exactly for a 4-credit course.
Two academic blogs with ambiguous instruction. No sample essay for reference. Many requirements to fulfil in a 400 words essay. So fucking ridiculous.
SDL tasks and 2 electives that costs at least 1-2 hours.
Perusall (reading material and responding to the question at the beginning) is garbage and time-costing.

The most annoying is coming
1. 6-8 mins multimodal video. How can I learn English through editing videos??????? How???  Nothing can be learned in this video. reviews.author: aaaat
reviews.title: Amazing grading
reviews.comment_content:
Two main topics:
Beauty and happiness
Water blowing stuff, not difficult
Any expectation of learning English is vain, Lang course is not very useful for students of average or above English proficiency.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Alfred is a nice tutor. He welcomes questions and is willing to provide you with help. He tried to make some jokes but his lesson is still quite boring tbh.
You can't be totally unconscious during lessons as he will randomly pick some students to answer questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is extremely GOOD!
I got a B- from Lang 1002 and I got an A- this time.
Compare to my tutor of Lang 1002, Alfred is very generous in grading everything i.e. assignments, essays, and speaking.
I think he normally will give 5/6 out of 7 to upper-intermediate students.
reviews.comment_workload:
Compare to Lang 1002 (Nick Wong), this course is really chill. No after-school group works! (Thank god)
There are 2 short essays+ writing processes asm about beauty and happiness that you need to work on. These are not difficult but you have to be careful with the citing which you learned from Lang 1002. Appropriate citing count for 1 mark.

Generally speaking, Elpa is not difficult except reading. I can understand the whole passage, but I only got 60% in reading... Maybe it's just my problem...

reviews.author: sim
reviews.comment_content: The course have two units, one about beauty and another one is about happiness. The content is quite easy to follow. Need to take attendance.
reviews.comment_teaching: Responsible teachers, provided adequate notes and guidelines to follow. Will call studentsâ€™ name and ask them to answer questions. Need to finish every task in the textbook as homework.
reviews.comment_grading: The marks she gave me is proportional to the effort I pay on the course, however the final grade is so bad.
reviews.comment_workload: Need to do every task in the book but they are easy to finish, just need to do preparation before the lecture.

reviews.comment_teaching:
She is very nice. Her teaching is fair. She made her own powerpoint slides for every lesson, each student was asked some questions every lesson, but the workload of the classwork is not heavy.
One point to add is that she explained the requirements of the assessment very clearly.
reviews.comment_grading: Fair. I got a B+ and I think it matched with the amount of effort I put into it.
reviews.comment_workload: Not much workload, I didnâ€™t finish some of his homework but itâ€™s still ok. But sometimes you had finish her in-class practice so that she would take your attendance for the lesson.

reviews.author: Binotto
reviews.title: Iâ€™d recommend you to take IELTS or TOEFL to avoid these LANG Courses
reviews.comment_content:
The concepts of beauty and happiness are the main concepts of this course. The first half of the courses discusses about the concepts. The professor suggests  ideas for the argumentative essay that we are required to submit on the topic of beauty.

The second half discusses the concept of happiness. There are no assignments for the this section of the course. As weeks go by, the focus shifts towards the preparation for the ELPA test and the graded academic discussion.

Two boring concepts used to improve and test the language proficiency of UST students.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Some teachers try their best to make the class interesting but often fail. Students arenâ€™t interested to participate in breakout rooms(including myself) and itâ€™s understandable.
Participation may help in impressing the professor for a better grade but itâ€™s highly unlikely.
reviews.comment_grading:
A slightly better grading that itâ€™s counterpart.

Essay Topic Proposal:10%
Argumentative Essay: 25%
12 Practice VOLT tests+ Brief self-reflection : 10%
Academic Discussion (Speaking) :25%
ELPA(Writing Test): 30%

Essay: 6 6 5 4(19/28)
VOLT: 4/4
Speaking: 6 6 5 5
Writing: 19/26(MCQ Comprehension)

A easy scoring course for students with a good level of English proficiency.

reviews.comment_teaching:
She is very very nice. She made her own PPT every lesson. PPT is tidy and clear. You can review it before doing homework. Also, she is willing to answer your questions.

To be honest, LANG1003S content is quit boring and students usually think that Lang Lesson is boring and useful. However, her teaching makes me feels that I have really learnt something useful and it can be used in the future.
reviews.comment_grading:
My English is not really good and I only got lev4 in DSE. I think you just pay attention in the class, follow the instructorâ€™s advice and try your best to finish your homework, your grade will be nice.

Finally got an A- :)
reviews.comment_workload: Appropriate workloads.

reviews.author: LeePresident
reviews.title: Quite OK grade
reviews.comment_content:
Two topics are taught this year: beauty and happiness, which are quite boring to me.

80% is the minimum attendance requirement. And you need to hand in an argumentive essay about beauty and also your plan of the essay, which they contribute to 35% of the grade (25%+10%)

Also, group discussion (25%) and vocabulary learning with 12 VOLT tests and the short paragraph (10%) are required.

ELPA (30%) is compulsory for all students this semester which includes a speaking test consisting of an adapted version of Part 1: only Question 2 (compare and contrast) & Question 3 (giving opinions) and Part 2 (suggesting solutions) in 5 minutes and a writing and reading test (total 80 minutes).
reviews.comment_teaching:
Martin Ma is my instructor this semester but I cannot find his name in the relative column. He always encourages us to have group discussions in the breakout room.
He is quite fun and lenient in giving marks and he quite explains well the assignments so I know how to do them.
reviews.comment_grading:
Essay 5/0/6/6/5 (7/1/7/7/7)
Essay Process 4 (4)
Discussion 5/4/5 (7/7/7)
Vocabulary Learning 3 (4)
ELPA:
Speaking 5/5/5/4 (7/7/7/7)
Reading 16 (26)
Writing Unknown

Overall B+
Excited for me because I only get C or C- in other courses this semester.
reviews.comment_workload: You need to ensure that the assignments can be handed in on time. The overall workload is quite moderate and the reading test of ELPA relies on mainly previous knowledge in high school and some from this course.

reviews.author: ffskw
reviews.title: Good instructor
reviews.comment_content:
Beauty
Happiness
To be honest, these 2 topics are quite boring for me.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Eunice rarely referred to the coursebook.
She didn't force us to turn on our camera so sometimes half of the class turned off their cameras which was disappointing.
She would randomly pick someone to answer her question.
She replied to my emails very quickly and they were detailed.
Overall, she is a very friendly instructor
She gives good grades and encourages our proactivity
She is a good instructor.

Speaking:
An academic discussion task (25%)
555

Writing:
An argument essay (25%)
50454

Evidence of the process of researching and writing your essay (10%)
3

Vocabulary Learning:
Completion of 12 VOLT practice tests

4

Speaking 5545

Writing: No idea
(Total 30%)
I have no idea what my results were for some tests
Overall Grade: B+
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is not heavy compared to other courses.

You have to complete an essay about beauty which I think it is already the biggest workload of this course.

12 Practice tests on VOLT are simple. They are about vocabulary utilization. You can look up the dictionary to complete it. This means you can complete all of them in a very short period of time.

You do not really have to prepare so much for the speaking tasks but you can prepare some statistics and facts to help support your ideas.

ELPA exams: I don't think you can do much about reading and writing. There are sample papers available online. Again, you may prepare some facts or statistics for your speaking exam.

In general, I think the workload is not heavy.

reviews.comment_content: Basically about reading and discussing the textbook content of beauty and happiness. Group discussion about the short tasks like 'how to define beauty', 'how is beauty defined in different areas', so on. Alfred usually plays some interesting youtube videos when the class begins. reviews.author: S. Kenneth C
reviews.title: Good class environment and nice tutor <3
reviews.comment_content:
2 topics:
Beauty
Happiness

Different from 1002, first part of LANG1003S focuses on argumentative writing with topic of beauty. (Remember to hand in the writing process form and feedback form)
After that, in module 2, Happiness. You'll learn academic discussion with different techniques which is very important for the discussion assessment.

2 Vocab test
ELPA:
Normally, Reading, listening and vocab test is also needed. But, this semester only have writing and speaking test.
reviews.comment_teaching: We all contributed to a good learning environment. I originally thought it maybe a boring course for me. But turns out that we can make the class funny if we are more active. Doreen is quite good and care about our feelings a lot. All the things that you should know for assignment and assessment are well-covered.

reviews.comment_content:
There were two big modules, including beauty and happiness.
These modules were quite boring, and some of the facts were just common sense. Yet, you should still pay attention during class, as the facts might become a part of your arguments in the speaking and writing assessment.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Linda is a good teacher, she was fair on grading. Not too lenient, not too strict. If you pay certain efforts on your work, she would definitely see it and appreciate your work. During class, she tried to give everyone equal chances to answer questions. She did not favor any student in the class, and she randomly selected students on answering questions or making a presentation. If you have any questions or doubts, feel free to ask her, as she is always willing to answer your question. She also provided us with different useful resources, such as citation format for different resources.

Linda is a local teacher which is good and fair, so don't swap to another class if you were admitted to her class!

reviews.author: SQ Flyer
reviews.title: Don't enroll in è‚¥å¸«å¥¶ class anymore, good luck to your ELPA
reviews.comment_content:
A course with a è‚¥å¸«å¥¶
The course syllabus is very outdated, the textbook and course materials are just the same as the previous years, which have limited use for improving students' English proficiency.

The course adopts the same teaching methodology,in a thematic approach. Two themes are included, Beauty and Happiness, which I find useless and boring.

Classes are like working on the textbook activities and some discussions and chit-chatting. Giving out limited guidelines for the assessed tasks.

Don't even spend any of the class time on ELPA preparation, you should register a time-slot working on the ELPA mock to get familiar with the difficulty and paper-setting.


åƒå¥‡å””å¥½Reg è‚¥å¸«å¥¶å–Engineä»” æˆ‘å¾æƒ³ä¿‚2030 å†è¦‹åˆ°å€‹è‚¥å©†
reviews.comment_teaching:
Her classes are chaotic and unorganized, sometimes I find her classes are time-consuming with no rewards.

Every time when the class begins, she requires every classmate to talk about their status, asking questions like "XX, How are you? " repeatedly, which I find time-consuming and irrelevant to the course. If you are not Business students, don't expect her pay attention to what you say, since Business students are more talkative and able to arouse topics that Engineering students are not familiar with, like popular culture and Business studies. Sometimes she might invite students to do silly stuff in front of the class, like singing and J-talking.

As the class continues, she follows the textbook and read aloud the content of the powerpoint that she prepared, then conduct some time-talking and group discussions, sharing and language tasks. She talks in an impatient way, like "yea, yea, yea...."
So what you are likely to respond,Elaine?

The only thing I would praise is, she ends the class early once she finished all the content, which I find myself relieved after suffering for an hour.

If you are Engineering or Science students, then good luck to you. Business students? Do what you like as usual.
reviews.comment_grading:
Marking rubics:
Writing Task 20%
Group Discussion 20%
Vocab Test (5%+10%=15%)
Participation 5%
ELPA 40%

Elaine provides very limited and pointless feedback for the writing task, she is like marking the tasks in a casual way. When I received my feedback (not the score) of my essay, she said the essay was well-written, but finally turned out the score not as expected. She marked the tasks with very low transparency and bias, especially if you are Engineering student not Business student, don't expect you can receive proper result, she is an irresponsible and unfair instructor.

The only way that secure your grade is ELPA, it's all about your ability to perform well for different papers and the oral test. Probably it's relatively fair.

ELPA:
Four 4
Five 5
One 6

Turn out B- wtf it's totally unacceptable man please be careful if you want good grade though everyone knows LANG courses are just wasting your time ruining your U life.
reviews.comment_workload:
Comparing to LANG1002, this course doesn't have a heavy workload.

The assignments that spent you more time are the essay about beauty and the group discussion about promoting happiness in HK. You need to work on the preparations and finish the tasks on time.

Two vocabulary tests as usual, testing 40/120 words from the lists respectively. Just need to check the meaning and usage of the vocabularies.

The ELPA test consists of several papers:
Reading ( a passage - MC fill in the gaps, academic article MC with some T/F/NG questions)
Writing (one argumentative essay 300 words - like IELTS)
Listening (4 tasks all MC, difficulty increase gradually)
Vocabularies (MC choosing the most suitable vocabulary which matches the meaning & fill in the blanks- 3K/5K/10K/AWL vocabularies)
Speaking (like IELTS- one-to-one Q&A on a specific topic, two min speech with a question related to the specific topic)

reviews.comment_teaching:
this semester is online mode
mostly group discussion in class, usually the instructor introduces topic for that class and then students are sent to break out rooms to discuss and fill in a form
the instructor may invite some students to share their answer with classmates

for the group project, my instructor assigned two consultant sections, he indicated some potential problems of the video script based on the work presented to him
reviews.comment_grading:
no exam
the group project counts for the largest portion of grading
did not finish the reading seriously, just fulfilling the minimum requirement
got a B+
reviews.comment_workload:
around three reading assignment, need to highlight related sentences in the article according to the homework introduction
students are divided into groups of 3-4 people producing a 3min video presenting a topic chose at the beginning of the semester, as the video is a group project, workload can be medium to high depends on whether your group-mates are free-riders
my group talked about pros, cons, limitations and usages of microlearning

reviews.author: Sailor_Sea
reviews.title: Multimodality?
reviews.comment_content:
1. Academic Writing
2. Citations
3. Multimodality in communication (kinda confused cuz it's barely discussed, so not many people know how to perform well in this aspect)
I think the academic writing part in the beginning of the course is quite good because it really do improve my English, using a wider range of vocabulary. However, the multimodality part is kinda confusing because how can we perform well in that part? Adding pictures in writings are the usual thing, but it seems inadequate, and I expect something more if the course is primarily focusing on multimodality.
I also like the part where we are allowed to discuss with groupmates. It gives us the capacity to interact with people and make friends.
You also gotta make a video to present in the end which involves multimodality. Just try to gather some video-editing skills and add some visuals into it. But also don't forget and hesitate about the body movements and facial expressions because these are the multimodal effects which don't require any editing skills. I think these are the criteria which lecturers are looking forward to.
Overall, multimodality is a headache to everyone.
reviews.comment_teaching: My lecturer in this course is Sumie and she is really kind and helpful. I am really grateful because she empathize with people for the complexity of the course. She tried to explain everything in a precise manner, so that everyone will at least have the chance to outperform in the course. I think it's also fun to have a chitchat with her in the beginning of the class or whenever having a discussion, which I regret not having that much.
reviews.comment_grading: I think the grading is okay because most of my friends, either weak or competent in English, get at least a B range in this course. However, the only one factor that everyone is worried about is the criteria of every competencies, such as grammar usage and multimodality, and the distribution of grades. As I have mentioned, multimodality.... the course didn't include much information about this aspect, while being the title of this course, so how is this part being graded?
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is kinda heavy but not to the max, and it would be an advantage for ppl who are obsessed with English and video-editing.
1. 2 academic blogs
2. Persuall writing analysis (make comments)
3. Storyboard (outline of the video)
4. Video Presentation
5. Reflections
Thank god I got sembreak in Spring to complete these.
Though video editing is said to be not graded, so you don't need editing skills, but I think it's still required somehow because how are you going to create multimodal effects without editing, such as objects movement?

reviews.author: MartinLeung
reviews.comment_content: It needed us to finish a multimodality project this year which means we have to prepare an 8-minute video. It is expected to learn how to reference the video and what element to be added to a video through this class. Also, the project requires you to work in a small group so that you could enhance your communication skills.
reviews.comment_teaching: The course is taught under zoom and the interaction between teacher and students are very limited.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is horrible as everyone in this class doesn't get grades above the B range.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is heavy as the video preparing process will last through the whole semester.

reviews.author: astral
reviews.title: avoid this course if possible
reviews.comment_content:
It covers multi-modality, academic blogs...etc

they will teach you how to use ust library to search articles for academic blogs, but it's not useful at all.

they will also teach you the synthesis of information from sources, but the most important thing is the multimodal project presentation. You need to form a group of 4-5 and make a video around 8mins. This project is to inform others about the topic we chose and make recommendations for the 21st-century study.

To be honest, I still don't understand other groups' topics after I review their video.
reviews.comment_teaching:
the course is bad but Shaun is good.
he will explain the ppt in detail and he is willing to answer our questions
reviews.comment_grading:
very bad grade
the instructor gives me very high marks but I only get B-
reviews.comment_workload:
very heavy
you need to finish 2 academic blogs and a storyboard sharing session and an 8mins video, the schedule is very tight, you will have to start the project as soon as possible.

reviews.author: ABCDDï½
reviews.title: Heavy Workload
reviews.comment_content: Different kinds of skills including analyzing, critical thinking, coherence, team working, etc. The first few lessons are easy and chill and later on the lessons are mostly about the group project (the video). And also there are some blended lessons which you can have your lesson yourself at anytime before the deadline.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching depends on the instructor. From what I have heard, basically all classes are similar, having chill discussion in class and most instructors is friendly unless it is not.
reviews.comment_grading: It depends on the instructor a lot. You can get a bad grade even you are good in English or get a good grade with poor English. Be active in class so that the instructor can remember you!
reviews.comment_workload: Quite heavy. You need to make a video and a presentation as a group. So it is strongly recommended to select your group mates wisely.(Find your friend to reg the course together will be a good choice) Otherwise, you may leave with a bad grade. Also, there is some blogs, SDL tasks, Perusall that no one care. They are not difficult but time-consuming. The workload is quite heavy but you can't  drop this class. hahahahaha Good luck!

reviews.author: Hihi32
reviews.title: Not Bad ge
reviews.comment_content:
I don't think this curse has taught me any new English concepts that I haven't already learned in secondary school. But the course is required lol, so just try your best to finish all the requirements and get good grades to improve your GPA.
You must select a topic to discuss for the academic blog that is connected to contemporary jobs or studies. You are given some topic suggestions, so don't worry if you don't know where to begin.
You might select the same topic for the group project and reuse the data from your earlier academic blogs. Don't finish it at the last minute because it takes a lot of time.
reviews.comment_teaching: He has a very laid-back and occasionally slow teaching style, in my opinion. His teaching method seems to be appropriate for an introvert because he won't press you to respond to his question. However, I believe he gives good grades. I found that I receive very decent grades from him despite the fact that I don't think I am a good writer. His lessons weren't particularly engaging, so just go attend the lesson and sit there and everything will be okay. He is also a very nice person.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grade was quite good.
The essay and group project are crucial but don't anticipate this teacher being able to offer much assistance. Make an effort on your own and seek help from others to edit or provide feedback on your essay. Don't really know how the grading scheme works, so just make sure you do your best even though he is not a very strict teacher.
reviews.comment_workload:
- 2 academic blogs
- 1 group project with video recording and q&a section
- online forum discussion with tons of questions (but they are easy)
- weekly online tasks (some may require you to take videos lol)
- a few reflection essays
I would say the course workload is quite heavy but the grading is good so I won't blame him for that.

reviews.title: Nothing would be learnt.Good luck
reviews.comment_content:
No more ELPA (English proficiency exam)! This course focuses on 21st century abilities such as communication, critical thinking, collaboration, and creativity, and your final project will be a video.

Nonetheless, things become chaotic throughout this online semester, and everything you learned appears to be meaningless.For instance, John directed us to do annotation activities on the Perusall, such as highlighting topic sentences and suggesting a few key words for paragraphs.For a university English course, those tasks are pointless and superfluous.What a dull course!
reviews.comment_teaching:
John is an instructor who provides specific advice during consultations or after class.

However, he consistently misses e-mails, which irritates and alarms me. If you have the same problem, you may need to track him down after class or close the Zoom conference.

And you gonna hate his earrape background music before the Zoom meeting starts (Gosh)
reviews.comment_grading:
There are two sections to the grading system:

1. Final Project(70%)
-The 6- to 8-minute video is worth 30%

-The two blogs are worth 25%
Blog 1 is about reading, summarising, and commenting on an
article (300 - 400 words).
Blog 2 involves reading two articles  and commenting on them
based on similarities and contrasts (300 - 400 words).

-Other tasks worth 15% include sharing your experience,
cooperation, and peer feedback.

2. Self-directed/independent learning (30%)
-2 out of 4 electives
-Perusall(commenting on articles)
-Reflections

Because this is a renew course, lecturers appear to be inclined to give you a lower grade on every job you complete. However, the final grade is acceptable.
reviews.comment_workload:
"Better than LANG1002S," I'd add, but everything is repetitive and tedious.
You also cannot skip Lang1003S classes, therefore it feels like a torture to me.A one-hour and fifteen-minute class feels like a three-hour lesson.Good luck.

The content of LANG1003 is based on two topics:
1. Beauty 2. Happiness
Because of the COVID-19, the course has posted the e-textbook on canvas as well as other supporting materials such as videos and links.
What I heard about that is: They are all synchronized with all LANG1003 sections. AND THEY ARE INADEQUATE IN THE VIEW OF A YEAR ONE STUDENT. WHY???? BECAUSE THEY DON'T TELL YOU MUCH ABOUT ALL THE ASSIGNMENTS, ESSAYS, SPEAKING EXAMS, ELPA......

To be honest, that matter is beyond Eugene's control. And he is definitely well prepared for the teaching and adds many contents other than the textbook. The meaningless and time-consuming "Vocab List Exercise" is gone and has been replaced by a simple Vocab exercise online and some reading. Each lecturer has a different method for the reading part, for example, my friend's lecturer is asking him to read an article for half-hour and then answer some questions.

For Eugene, he set up a half-hour reading session on Friday. However, there is no restriction on the choice of reading materials. So, some students like me are always reading textbooks HAHAHA. We read and prepare from other lectures at the same time.

reviews.author: Tokumei
reviews.comment_content:
This course will focus on developing studentsâ€™ academic literacy skills for university studies, while continuing to enhance their language proficiency. Key features of the teaching materials, student activities, and assessments will be self-directed learning, communication within a team, and multimodal communication. With the focus on academic literacy, this course introduces students to research skills for finding and evaluating sources for academic writing and speaking tasks. It expects students to be critical in their reading and writing, as they organize, substantiate and synthesize ideas when developing coherent and strong arguments. Collaboration and leadership skills will also be emphasized to further develop skills and habits for autonomous lifelong learning.

LANG 1003's assessments include the following:

70% of the grade for a multimodal project, which is broken down into several steps
30% of the grade for self-directed learning
In the table below, you can see the general timeline for the assessments.

The multimodal project will begin with 3-4 students making a group and selecting one of the research topics. The group will next write a team contract. The 10-week research projects continues with library research, two academic blogs, a draft of the video in the "storyboard" session, consultations, and a final presentation (see details in the Assessments area of Canvas).

The Self-Directed Learning includes the online/blended learning work (including the library workshop), the electives, and an end-of-term reflection (see details in the Assessments area of Canvas).
reviews.comment_teaching: Fantastic. Not only will Rebecca read your material carefully and give you clear directions for improvement, but she will also guide you on how to apply these language skills in other courses in the future. In the evaluations of the surrounding classmates and seniors, her teaching method and reputation are the best in this course.
reviews.comment_grading: Nearly impossible to get A+ in this course, but decent grade could be easily achieved by actively participating and keep communicating with instructor after lesson via email or f2f. If you can ameliorate your written task and received nearly full marks (nearly all facets in 5, some in 4.5), I believe that you will received at least A range. Rebecca is pretty nice in grading sections comparing with most of other instructors, and I got A in her course.
reviews.comment_workload: Really depends on how you learn this course and what ur grade expectation is. If youâ€™re pursuing for A range, you really need to put tremendous extra time on improving ur written tasks and group project (e.g., leading your group and planing for extra meeting with instructor). Well, if you ainâ€™t, no need to wasting your time on preparing for that, and the workload will be normal.

reviews.author: Lawrence Cheung
reviews.title: Overall a wholesome experience, with some ups and downs.
reviews.comment_content: Wasn't too much written skills related, more stressed on speaking proficiency as more of the grading weights towards the final presentation. Remember to talk more during lessons even in a online mode. Attention to detail, make sure you check all the boxes of mulitmodality.
reviews.comment_teaching: Consultations were provided to review on the two pieces of acdemic writing, my tutor always gave constructive feedbacks. Very grateful for it.
reviews.comment_grading: Received an A minus at the end of the semester. Considering I did not do well in both of my acdemic blogs, the grading surely exceeded my inital expectations.
reviews.comment_workload: Light work, not very time demanding. At the end of the day, it won't be the course that worries you the most.

reviews.author: ggg_
reviews.title: Quite large workload
reviews.comment_content:
The central topic is 21st century study and work. After some introduction to the course and getting to know your classmates, it is about multimodality, research and library skills, reading, and writing skills like citing, summarizing, synthesis, supporting arguments etc.
Some of my classmates considered many of the contents to be useless, but I think I learnt some important things like the research skills, writing skills and teamwork skills. (Or maybe I learnt much of these from my wonderful teammates!) In addition, though making the video and writing academic blogs are really time-consuming, I like multimodality as it allows me to add a little creativity to the assignments, and I acquired some skills that I consider quite useful and thus grew a strong sense of accomplishment.
reviews.comment_teaching: I think he basically read the contents on the student notes/his slides and make some elaborations and explanations. He sometimes don't reply to emails. And since this is a new course this year, many instructors don't know much about the requirements themselves, including Eugene. It's more efficient to read the instructions and guidelines yourself. But he seems to be willing to give feedback on your writing. BTW, he seems to be quite mean about attendance, so make sure you always arrive several minutes earlier and don't turn off your camera during the classes.
reviews.comment_grading:
I don't know many other people's grade, so I can't tell whether the grading is good or not. My grade is good (cuz I really put much much time and effort into it) but seems usually LANG courses are easy to get bad grades.

Grading Scheme:
1.Multimodal Project(70%):
Academic Blog1(10%)
Academic Blog2(10%)
Use of sources in academic blogs(5%)
Storyboard(5%)
Peer evaluation(5%)
Teamwork(5%)
Presentation and Q&A(30%)
SDL(Self-Directed Learning):
Online classwork and out of class work (10%)
The â€œlearning to learnâ€ entrance to the electives + 2 more electives (5%)
Reflection Tasks (15%)

Very complicated
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is quite big. Or maybe one of the reason it is so tiring is that instructors themselves are not able to explain on each assignment clearly so we have to go through all the instructions by ourselves? I spent several days finding sources, reading sources and writing each of the academic blogs. We treated the storyboard session seriously and made lots of preparations. The two electives also took much time. Preparing for the video is also time-consuming. We spent lots of time synthesizing our contents, writing a scipt and finding media sources. (pictures and videos and music) And I was the one who finally combined these materials into the final video and added subtitles. Editing a video is really a huge task. It took me several days. We then wrote the short script for live presentation and Q&A. However, there are still three reflection tasks (one talking-head video, two writings) waiting for you after all these. Anyway, work hard and good luck...

reviews.comment_content:
Don't know why the ust space doesn't have the instructors option Martin Ma, but whatever.

1.) We will use a textbook that is provided and we follow the order. Unit one then unit two etc.
2.) Quite a lot of readings tasks, require students to answer the questions after the reading time.

reviews.comment_grading:
I was surprised by my final grading!!!!!!!
I got an A for this course! All I want to say is thank you to the instructor and myself XDXD.
As I got some experience from Lang 1002s, I knew that every single task counts your course grade, I really finished all of the assignments wholeheartedly and I definitely did more than what I suppose to do.

Ok, here are some details about course grading:
1.) Vocab lists, feedback on the vocab list
2.) Essay plans, essays
3.) Group discussion
4.) Elpa reading task, writing task, and speaking task.
5.) Attendance.

*Sth I think might also count:
A good attitude during lessons! E.g. engaging level in lessons, like being active during group discussion, grab the chance to answer the instructor's questions!

reviews.author: An225 Mriya
reviews.comment_content:
As you can expect, it's really the same as those people wrote before, and you know the entire content isn't really about these topics:
Unit 1: Beauty
Unit 2: Happiness
Perhaps CLE just wants to accommodate sosci students, but the change in the content add some difficulty to assignments (such as scrambling for art and aesthetics stuff in the library--as an engineering student)...
reviews.comment_teaching:
As someone said before, Eunice did well in making the lessons active by asking questions and sending students into breakout rooms (not the kind of breakout rooms where you are then left without advice). I also received some emails from her, commending active participation and good practices on the lectures. Generally good teaching.

Tbh, I must said that I'm quite lucky to be pre-enrolled into two consecutive good lecturer throughout my first year.
reviews.comment_grading:
Archived CLE grading page:
http://web.archive.org/web/20210608081042/https://cle.ust.hk/courses/lang1003s/course_assessment/

Speaking (25%): 5+5+5
Vocab learning (10%): 4
Writing (25%): 5+5+6+1
Essay writing process (10%): 4
ELPA(30%):
*Speaking: 5+5+4+4
*Reading: I remembered should be some ~80% after the results are released on Canvas.
*Writing: Never revealed, though referring to my grade, I think they should be sufficiently good.

As a student who get demoted from LANG1002A, I'm quite surprised to get an A for LANG1003S. Though the grades for assignments aren't really good, you really have a chance to change your destiny by focusing more on the ELPA.
reviews.comment_workload:
Average workload... Similar to LANG1002, the essay writing should consume most of your effort throughout the sem, as you be busying in finding resources and dealing with the structure of the essay. The vocabulary learning, unlike LANG1002, is conducted using Volt. You'll need to complete all vocabulary tests and submit a piece of reflection... in which you can simply spam it...

The speaking assignment is a group discussion, though you should prepare for very well-prepared discussion participants to carpet bomb the discussion. DSE speaking skills also help.

The ELPA concludes the course (or practice, for those who believe that LANG1002/3 didn't teach new knowledge), and I would said skills and experiences in other standardized English tests like IELTS and TOEFL should be useful as well.

reviews.author: operator=
reviews.comment_content: He mainly taught the content in the textbook.In his class,he divided a large amount of time in group discussion,he really encourages us to think of new points and speak them aloud.
reviews.comment_teaching: I don't know why I can't find the name of this instructor and he is  MELICAN,Mark Anthony. He is kind to us, and will explain what you don't understand patiently.He will give feedback in time.He is nice so don't be afraid,if you want to ask for feedback or questions,just directly ask him on whatsapp,he will carefully analyze your essay and will correct some of yours.Not only he will give more comment on group discussion and essay,he is also willing to give feedback on anything you write.He is welcome for a face to face discussion.Or you can just chat with him to get some advice on how to improve your proficiency in English or sports like football.He is a fan of Manchester United and I am sure he won't decline your passionate.
reviews.comment_grading:
Of course, as for native teacher,his criterion is  higher.As for me, what he appraised is that nearly every sentences in your essay has a better way to construct or there are small grammar mistakes or words that are used inappropriately.And for  speaking he is also strict so my marks has dropped a lot compared to last semester.But to my surprise,when the grade comes out,it seems that he is not that strict as he gives mark in speaking and writing.I can feel that my endeavor has been revered and I am grateful for it so I think he is not a cold-blooded killer as I have heard at the beginning of this term and I think no pain,no gain,if you make all effort you can make to get high score, I think he will notice your effort and give you the grade that you deserve.

ELPA speaking test:6555(I don't understand what is the definition of a 7-mark-pronunciation)

reviews.title: A rediculous course
reviews.comment_content:
I dunno it's the course problem or the teaches' but Eric spent almost all the lecture time discussing "standard Beauty" can Happiness in Butan. and only analyzed an argumentative essay( simply telling us we need a TS, evidence, citation and conclusion in the essay) , and 0 lesson on discussion.
teaching us nothing about the writing & speaking task.

reviews.author: NOOB_IN_UST
reviews.title: Good lecturer for overall
reviews.comment_content:
The content of LANG1003 is based on two topics:
1. Beauty 2. Happiness
Because of the COVID-19, the course has posted the e-textbook on canvas as well as other supporting materials such as videos and links.
What I heard about that is: They are all synchronized with all LANG1003 sections. AND THEY ARE INADEQUATE IN THE VIEW OF A YEAR ONE STUDENT. WHY???? BECAUSE THEY DON'T TELL YOU MUCH ABOUT ALL THE ASSIGNMENTS, ESSAYS, SPEAKING EXAMS, ELPA......

To be honest, that matter is beyond Eugene's control. And he is definitely well prepared for the teaching and adds many contents other than the textbook. For the practice of speaking, we have about a month of practice in the lectures, and the questions are sufficient for the preparation of the speaking exam.

The meaningless and time-consuming "Vocab List Exercise" is gone and has been replaced by a simple Vocab exercise online and some reading. Each lecturer has a different method for the reading part, for example, my friend's lecturer is asking him to read an article for half-hour and then answer some questions.

For Eugene, he set up a half-hour reading session on Friday. However, there is no restriction on the choice of reading materials. So, some students like me are always reading textbooks HAHAHA. We read and prepare from other lectures at the same time.   

Also, Eugene has set up a 10-week reading reflection exercise which is quite different and innovative. Why? He asks us to make a poem called "Haiku", creates promotional materials for recommending the books we are reading.... very interesting.
But why Eugene you stop replying starting in week 7??? We are curious about others' comments including Eugene.
reviews.comment_teaching:
He is well prepared for the teaching.
He provides some games for us in the lectures which are very helpful in the teaching.

The 1-minute speaking warmup task is good as it becomes our main source of practice speaking assessment when the questions are laying the foundation of a better understanding in happiness, thus you can speak more in the speaking assessment.
(To my classmates in the same class, please forgive me for proposing "crazy points and opinions" in the speaking practices and the assessment, as I think that knowledge is common sense for me -.- and if I don't do that you guys will running out of topics easily.)

Besides, we even held a gathering in LG7 for lunch, although he insisted that we should only be speaking English as we already don't have much chance for the practice of English. Thus, only me and Eugene were talking the whole time.
(At this point, some should already know who I am, HAHA, I don't care!)

Well, there is always some improvement for Eugene:
1. Classroom Management
Some students are obviously not paying much attention to the lecture when Eugene was asking a student called XXX to answer some questions, the student said he did not pay any attention to the lecture, and Eugene simply said please pay attention now. That upset some students.

2. The problem of early ending lecture
The lectures were held on Wednesday and Friday 1630-1750, especially in the Friday lecture, he always ends the lecture early, which has raised some concerns and upset.

3. Stop the zoom meeting too fast so we can't ask questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is very good for me. Comparing Eugene with my LANG1002 lecturer Lee Long Shaun WONG. Shaun is more concerned about the accuracy of grammar and pronunciation. I know that he is quite hard-working, he gave detailed reasons and comments in the marks posted in the CLE assignment feedback system. But, his comments are quite harsh and iron -.-

In LANG1002, Shaun at most gave me 2 to 3 marks in my assessments, thus I got a C grade in LANG1002.

(My guessing) Eugene has the experience of teaching HD /ASSO, thus his teaching style is very similar to my experience in HD, thus I am more acceptable to Eugene's teaching. And his grades us in the similar fashion of my lecturers back in HD. In short, that is giving students credits for the encouragement to try English.

Writing Task (25%)
4/0/5/4/5    Full mark is 7

Essay Writing Process (10%)
4    Full mark is unknown to me

Speaking assessment (Not ELPA) 25%
5/5/5   Full mark is 7

Vocab learning reflection(10%)
4   Full mark is unknown to me

ELPA speaking assessment  (Total ELPA made up 30% of the total marks of the grade of LANG1003)
5/5/5/4

ELPA writing/reading assessment
Reading 20
writing unknown

Estimated grade I will get:
B to C+

Update: Finally I got B+

You have an essay, essay writing plan, vocab learning reflection, weekly reading tasks...
Not much to be honest.

reviews.title: good grade course if you meet a good tutor
reviews.comment_content:
two units: Beauty & Happiness
unit 1 focus on writing
unit 2 focus on speaking
general stuff
reviews.comment_teaching:
Responsible and caring teacher.
She will try to keep every student in the lecture pay attention to her, and the teaching pace is slow so that everyone can follow easily.
Even though everyone knows the content is boring, she tried to make more interaction in the lecture by asking questions. She reserved time for students to discuss and think, and you can stay behind the lesson if you have any further question.
Pionie is responsible in a way that she will keep track with your essay and learning progress if you wish to.
I remember she made more teaching material with her friend, and those material are somehow useful if you are not good at English.
Also, Pionie will use the Canvas to hold some discussion, that will be count into the participation marks.
To be honest, I think Pionie really make me more serious in learning language because she listens to students feedback, and you will be able to sense the effort Pionie spent on the students.
reviews.comment_grading:
You get what you paid.
The essay writing process: 4/4
The assessed writing: 4544 (0)
The assessed speaking: 665
Other vocab learning: 4/4
Vocab test 1: 10.5/20
Vocab test 2: 18/30
participation was not released. But I think it should be pretty high. Remarks: vocab practice in VOLT and discussion in Canvas is count into participation according to Pionie. Maybe every tutor has their own way to assess students' participation marks.
Final grade: A-
reviews.comment_workload:
Normal, even though writing an essay with low interest is annoying. If you are willing to speak and practice oral English then the speaking part is not a big deal.
Actually most important part is to answer the tutor's question during the lecture to earn more participation, but please be reminded that don't be too active so that your classmates have chances to earn some marks too.

reviews.title: Excellent Tutor
reviews.comment_content: Lang1003S, standard stream, beauty and happiness. Boring af, your English won't improve a lot after studying.
reviews.comment_teaching: Great professor! Slightly boring but you will surely learn a lot by following him.
reviews.comment_grading: Good grading. Your efforts will be correlated in your grade. Follow what Shaun teaches you, they will be what he expects your work. Also, answer questions during class and help him avoid dead-air will surely add points on your grading.
reviews.comment_workload: Standard LANG workload. You will have both essay and oral tasks. Also, you will have ELPA in 1003.

reviews.author: no_name_provide
reviews.comment_content:
depends on instructors
some instructors can really teach you useful English, but Andrew apparently not those excellent teachers

The course builds on LANG 1002 and aims to further develop students' proficiency in English as well as their academic literacy skills, so that they can cope with the linguistic demands of studying through the medium of English. The course aims to develop students' competence in reading and writing, as well as the ability to engage in oral interaction in social and academic contexts. For students under the four-year degree curriculum.

reviews.author: MoSorWaiLa
reviews.title: Don't expect you will improve your English throughout the course
reviews.comment_content: What I can only say is the topics were very clique as they had never been renewed. The first half semester was mainly about Beauty and the second half was about Happiness. There were some inputs for you every lesson, such as the videos on Ted Talk and some news reports and articles. However, they never taught you how to improve your English proficiency.
reviews.comment_teaching: While I believe the teaching quality is attributed to the content of the course, his teaching method is boring as he simply followed the power point and was not able to engage students in the course. I think he was adopting a laissez-faire approach to us. Positively thinking, he was quite lenient to students. Although sometimes he seemed very helpful, for example, he encouraged us to ask him questions, his advice was not very helpful. Once I consulted my essay outline with him, he simply told me my focus question was not debatable and  thesis statement was not good enough without suggesting me how to improve and looking at my arguments. It was a little bit frustrating as he was not helping solve my problems but adding more problems to me.
reviews.comment_grading: I think it largely depends on your overall performance in the class and the impression from your instructor. My essay got 55651 and my group discussion assessment got around 555. In the two vocab tests, I respectively got 17/20 and 24.5/30. As for my ELPA results, I cannot remember clearly but most of them were 5 and some 4. My performance is 4 in the class because I am quite willing to contribute in the discussion of the class.  My final grade is A-.
reviews.comment_workload: Apart from the main tasks (i.e. the essay, group discussion and ELPA), he had some homework for us every lesson but they were very simple and you didn't need to take it very seriously. I think most of my langmates didn't do it at all.

reviews.author: mint3
reviews.title: Fiona is the converse of killer
reviews.comment_content: Beauty and happiness. Not exactly interesting topics but I did learn something new. I only remembered in some places being fat is considered beautiful and Bhutan introduced the Gross National Happiness. Very impressive.
reviews.comment_teaching: We had a lot of discussion during the happiness part of the course, and most of the topics are actually down to the earth, for example, removing LANG courses from UST's required courses can promote happiness in UST.
reviews.comment_grading:
Due to the pandemic the grading is a bit different than previous semesters.
Do research thoroughly before you decide on your essay because you don't want your essay to turn out being a psychology paper.
Try to relate to anything in the assess speaking, any well-known example will do.

Essay about beauty (20%): 44441
Assessed speaking (20%): 655
ELPA speaking+writing (20%): 4444445
Participation (10%): 4/4
Essay writing process (10%): 3/4
Vocab test 1 (5%): 13/20
Vocab test 2 (10%): 21/30
Other vocabulary learning (5%): 4/4
Final grade: B+ (read the title)
reviews.comment_workload:
Not much.
One assessed writing task due week 7, vocab learning records due weeks 3, 6, 9, 12 (dictionaries exist), as well as study the vocab lists. Comparing to other courses, this course's workload is relatively low.

reviews.author: mmcy
reviews.comment_content:
First half of the course: Beauty
Second half of the course: Happiness
reviews.comment_teaching: He will not give much feedback about your essays or speaking tasks during lessons. Therefore, it is quite difficult to understand the standard of his markings in both essay and speaking task.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading was lenient.
Mostly got 4s and 5s in the writing and speaking task.
For elpa test, I got 655 in writing and 4445 in speaking.
Final grade: B+
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload was light.
There was no extra homework given by him. The only thing that you have to do was only prepare for the essay and speaking task.

reviews.author: Soberzz
reviews.comment_content: Beauty and Happiness, not quite interesting
reviews.comment_teaching: Asks questions frequently and encourages you to be more active in class. She will randomly call out your name, kind of helping you to get participation marks. Rarely refers to textbook. Lively teaching method.
reviews.comment_grading:
ELPA : writing 555 speaking 5555
Essay: 55440
Group Discussion: 556
Writing Process: 4
Other vocab learning: 4
Vocab test : 1. 13.5/20 2. 21.5/30
Participation: unknown
Overall Grade: A-
Assignment scores are not high actually, but good grading overall
reviews.comment_workload: One essay and one group discussion. Several vocab records. Not really demanding. But you have to revise quite a lot vocabulary just for quizzes.

reviews.author: No,Thankyou!
reviews.comment_content:
Beauty and Happiness
Writing task about beauty (20%)
+evidence of the process of researching and writing essay (10%)
Group discussion about happiness (20%)
Vocabulary test (15%)
Vocabulary learning (other words) (5%)
Participation (10%)
ELPA speaking and writing (20%)

like every Lang course
Attendance is required. so don't miss the class otherwise you will regret.
reviews.comment_teaching: Melissa was so nice and she is passionate in teaching English. Even though in this online semester, she will also help us to be more active in the class. She always gave us some times to have a 1-2 mins timed talking with our classmate in a breakout room. She encourages us to talk more in order to well prepare for the speaking and elpa speaking assessment. So I think this is good for us to have a practice because we almost don't speak in English out of the class. And also she is willing to answer any question regarding the assessment, so this can help us understand more about the criteria of marking. This is kind of exam oriented but you know, this is good for our grading :) As long as you are active in class, try to talk more and express your ideas well, I think Melissa will give you an acceptable grading.
reviews.comment_grading:
Writing 45441
writing process 4
speaking 454
vocab test 1 11/20
vocab test 2 23.5/30
other vocab learning 4
Participation unknown
ELPA 443 5444
Final grade = B+
Melissa grading was so lenient. Even I got average about ~4 (I think?), I still can have a B range.
reviews.comment_workload: Before every lesson, Melissa will give us some homework. This usually are some reading or exercise regarding the topic in the next lesson. So the purpose of these homework is just want to help you have a brief idea about the next lesson. All you need to do is just spend some time (usually less than half hour) to read through it. This is benefit for your own learning, trust me. For the assessment, Melissa almost guiding you throughout the semester. She will ask you to finish the process on time and she will have look and give you some feedback for improvement. After grading for assignment, she will also have consultation hour for you to ask whether you have question about the comment or marking.

boring topic because of the department.

reviews.author: **unknown**
reviews.title: Highly recommend Anthony
reviews.comment_content:
Mainly cover two main topics which are Beauty AND Happiness.
Students need to learn three vocabulary lists to finish vocabulary tests.
reviews.comment_teaching: Anthony knows how useless the content of the textbook is, so he tries to add more content during classes. For instance, he provides us with additional reading materials that are beneficial to our writing tasks. He also provokes our discussion by raising some inspiring questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
I think Anthony gives grades generously, and he is definitely not a killer. His influence on grading is mainly in the writing task on Beauty and speaking task on Happiness. Also, all students need to sit for ELPA at the end of the term which contributes part of the scores to your final grade.

Writing task: 6 6 6 6 1 (25/28)
Speaking task: 5 5 4 5 5 (24/35)
Vocabulary tests 1 & 2: 17/20 & 29/40
Participation: 4/4
ELPA: most are 4s and a few 5s

FINAL GRADE: B+

The ELPA really doesn't affect a lot in the final grade as long as you perform well in other assessments.
reviews.comment_workload:
Fair workload.
Only one writing task, one speaking task, two vocabulary tests and the ELPA.
As long as you follow what Anthony taught in classes and prepare the things well, you can finish the writing task easily.
I didn't prepare the ELPA at all since I think it is just a waste of time.

reviews.comment_content:
Beauty ( writing )
Happiness ( speaking )
reviews.comment_teaching:
LP is not a serious teacher and he will not force you to use english
You can easily get full participation mark if you keep speaking in class
he doesn't really care about attendance and you can skip class every now and then
He doesn't give full detail of writing and speaking in class so if you need help, you need to email him and he will respond and offer help
reviews.comment_grading:
ELPA is 40% of the mark so make sure you don't screw up
it is easy to get good grade in vocab test and participation
Overall, not a bad grade course
reviews.comment_workload:
Acceptable

reviews.author: zkel
reviews.title: Don't hesitate, choose her
reviews.comment_content:
The course covers 2 big topic, beauty and happiness. For beauty, the task of the topic is to write a research argument essay about any topic related to beauty. As the topic is decided by you, instructor will help you explore some parts of beauty to help you make the decision. Also, she will focus of training your writing skill. Just make use of what she teaches you and the academic writing format you have learnt then you can get a decent grade.
The second topic is happiness and the task for it is to have a 21 minutes speaking (2 minute individual speech + 1 minutes thinking time + 12 minutes group interaction). The goal of it is to reach a common position on which idea as you and your group suggested are most effective and feasible in improving happiness. So you will learn many speaking skills and things about happiness from the instructor. Just get well prepared, listen to her advice and speak like real conversation and then you can get good marks.
The most important thing of the course is not about what she has taught in class but ELPA. ELPA carry large proportion in the course and it really depends on how well you have learnt English since you were young. You will still get a bad grade even if you get excellent score in the tasks and fail ELPA. Soâ€¦..Good luck.
reviews.comment_teaching: Her teaching is excellent in every aspect. She is a very hard-working teacher. She teaches everything in the book while she also gives you extra notes prepared by her to help you understand the concept or finish the task. Her advice on tasks is very useful so you must listen to her in order to get good result. She will even spend time out of lesson to give personal feedback on your performance. The most important thing is that having her lesson is totally not boring and I enjoy having her lesson. The atmosphere of her lesson is very fun and you can even tell some joke and make fun of her during lesson, which makes the lesson really fun. She is god-class instructor if you want to learn things, get good grades while not wasting your time.
reviews.comment_grading:
As described above
Speaking Task: 20%
Writing Task: 20%
Vocabulary: 15% (5% + 10%)
ELPA: 40%
Participation: 5%
For me, I got one 6 and all 5 in writing task, one 6, one 4 and all 5 in speaking task, 17.5/20 +33/40 in the 2 voacb tests, 6554445444 for ELPA. Eventually I got A-, which in my opinion is a very good grade for my score. So I think her is grading is quite lenient as long as you are active in her class and punctual.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload of the course is lighter than the previous LANG 1002 course. However, she will give you some extra tasks for you to do to help you for the accessed tasks, including mock tests, planner, mock speaking practise and others. So donâ€™t choose her if you donâ€™t care about your grades and just want to hea.

reviews.author: I Want 1st Hon!
reviews.title: Speechless in ELPA! But...Po Lung GOOD GRADE!
reviews.comment_content:
Worse than LANG1002 due to the ELPA Exam!
B for Course Content; E for ELPA Exam

Week 1-7: Beauty
1. Writing Task
(600-800 words Argumentative Essay)
2. 1st Vocabulary Test (1st List: 40 words)

Week 8-13: Happiness
1. 2nd Vocabulary Test (All 3 lists: 120 words)
2. Speaking Task
(2 minutes individual presentation & Discussion on your group presentation: most effective and feasible suggestion)

In May, you have ELPA Exam...
Written Test (2.5 hours):
(Use Pencil, mark answers on MC ANS Sheet) Reading (40 mins), Listening (40 mins), Vocabulary MC
(Use Pen, write answers on the booklet) Vocabulary Fill in the blanks, Writing (40 mins)

The listening part is extremely fast...

Spoken Test (8 minutes):
1st part: 4 minutes Q & A (We answer the question(s))
2nd part: 1 minutes preparation time for 2 minutes speaking)
(Different topics for different candidates)
I got a topic related to Medicine & Health...
reviews.comment_teaching:
Greatly Recommended!

Great instructor who provides useful suggestion. You really can gain a lot in his class (his life experience & learning method)!
NOT exam method!

When you refer to SFQ, he has the highest rating out of all instructors!
He emphasises on our interaction and self-learning. Hence, NO HW is given.

MUST BE A in teaching!
I am lucky since Po Lung is my LANG1002 & LANG1003 teachers!
He gives fair grade (neither good nor bad)! He always watches whether you have any improvement and he will possibly give better grade to them! Thank you Polung for giving me a B!
reviews.comment_grading:
Course Assessment (60%):
1. Writing Task (Week 7): (20%)
I got all 5 out of 7 & 1 bonus mark for citation
(15% in total mark)
2. Speaking Task (Week 12-13): (20%)
I got all 5 out of 7 (14.28% in total mark)
3. Vocabulary Test: (15%: 5%+10%)
12.5/20 (5%) & 25.5/40 (10%)
Total: 38/60 (9.5% in total mark!)

Proficiency Assessment: (40%)
i.e. ELPA Exam
All ten marking criteria:
1)Listening
2)Reading
3)Vocabulary
4)Writing: Task fulfilment & organisation of ideas
5)Writing: Vocabulary range & accuracy
6)Writing: Grammar range & accuracy
7)Speaking: Topic development & coherence
8)Speaking: Vocabulary range & accuracy
9)Speaking: Grammar range & accuracy
10)Speaking: Pronunciation

I got seriously bad results: All 4 out of 7
hence 22.85% in total mark

Total mark: 61.6/100
Final Grade: B

reviews.author: chilllahaha
reviews.title: Anthony, very chill tutor
reviews.comment_content: It seems common sense to us that we can learn NOTHING from compulsory language course after taking LANG1002 in the fall semester. CLE is lazy enough not to modify the curriculum of LANG Course.  We have to waste our money to buy this fking useless, outdated LANG book for us to "LEARN".  I strongly recommend every Year 2 student to give away this "useful" LANG Book to Year 1 student in Year 2 Spring Semester
reviews.comment_teaching:
Anthony is an honest tutor. He knows the content of LANG1003 is just trash. (He said it by himself) But he is still trying his best to make use of the materials. There are assigned homework but Anthony never checked it seriously. He is quite a quality and all-rounded tutor and gives useful guideline (please ask questions on the formulation of the thesis statement as he is expecting a high quality on it which have a great influence on your grade). Just never hesitate to ask questions.
However, he can be very very annoying sometimes when he murmurs about his great workload in HKUST and when talking about his personal experience. But you know, just don't give af is fine.
reviews.comment_grading:
I think Anthony gives a reasonable grade and he is definitely not a killer. (In LANG 1003, most of the grade are distributed by other CLE tutor). His influence on grade would only be the writing task on beauty.
BTW, don't skip more than 5 classes if you do not want to retake LANG .
reviews.comment_workload:
I would like to give an E to the workload to LANG1003 because the ELPA test is just annoying. (p.s. please don't waste your time studying the 10k vocab if you are studying last-minute).

For Anthony, the workload would be B. He is not a strict tutor, but he requires everyone to finish the work earlier than the deadline so he can have a check and gives comment to us for improvement. For deadline fighter, it may seem to be "chur". But if you could receive feedback and have a better grade, I think it is a worth.

reviews.author: Moooon
reviews.title: Quite heavy workload but good grade
reviews.comment_content: Actually all Lang1003 classes have the same syllabus, so I don't think content should be one of the criteria that you should consider.
reviews.comment_teaching: She sticks to the textbook and completes every single tasks in the textbook. Videos will be played as they are included in the course materials. She likes calling students' name and ask them to answer questions. You are likely to be asked to answer a question nearly every lesson. She try to make the class more interesting by telling jokes sometime, but...... (You should understand) She always corrects students' mistakes (grammar or pronunciation) after their presentation. No Chinese and MOBILE PHONES are allowed in class, but you can ask her questions in Chinese after class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Attend the class on time. Always bring your textbook.

I did all the assignments and attended all the class. Sometime asked question regarding the assignments (submission/ word limit issues) and assessments.
Beauty essay: 5565+0 bonus
Speaking: 5555
Vocab test: 36
Participation: 4
ELPA: 6464555455
Final grade: A-
reviews.comment_workload: Many after-class exercises and readings. It is fine that if you do not complete them (not included the writing assessment) as long as you have a "good" friend who will tell you the answer whenever she ask you. Yet, doing all the homework can always give a better impression =)

reviews.author: chloeB
reviews.title: so sad
reviews.comment_content: just like every other lang course, you wont learn anything useful but still have to sit there.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Graham is a good teacher, really kind and trying to make the class interesting.
He would spend time talking to you and trying to give useful suggestions
reviews.comment_grading:
as a mainland student, never would I expect my getting a c range
: )
but I did in this class.
I have to admit that I performed really bad in vocabulary but as for writing. The criteria is really unpredictable.
reviews.comment_workload: Acceptable. Taking language class means that you do have to write essay, memorize words and prepare speech.

reviews.author: Antonio
reviews.title: Don't take 9 o'clock lesson if you're exco
reviews.comment_content: Just like Lang1002, with 2 major topics, "happiness" & "beauty".
reviews.comment_teaching: She dislikes exco, so if you're one, never sleep during class. But even if you're one, just be active. She likes to ask her students to prepare a presentation of the explanation of some of the vocabularies of the vocab list.
reviews.comment_grading: Normal. I've got a B range grade because I'm quite active in class.
reviews.comment_workload: Normal lang course workload. Just make sure to prepare early. There will be some presentation about the main topics of this course and some presentation about the vocal test.

reviews.author: IvanZhanggg
reviews.title: Tutor recommandation!
reviews.comment_content:
Please refer to other reviews :)
I did learn something useful thanks to Ivan!
reviews.comment_teaching:
Ivan is the best tutor I've ever met in UST!
Firstly, he is quite friendly and humorous. Ivan is able to remember everyone's name and even personality after several classes. He would encourage those who are shy or not willing to share their opinions to participate more during lecture. Before each class, he will play music or short videos for students to calm down and focus. Though he claims that he is strict with attendance, it is acceptable if being late for classes or skipping the class because of other activities once. Ivan even gave away chocolates and candies during holidays.
Then, Ivan is quite serious and enthusiastic about his job. He made slides for each class and provide a huge amount of examples for better understanding. He is used to making use of videos, Facebook articles and other interesting formats to arouse students' interest. His group discussions are well prepared and instructed as well. He is eager to help students with their English, so he is willing to answer your questions no matter during classes or through e-mails. He even provides extra exercise and mock test for vocab test. Ivan also provides useful and personal feedbacks for each assignment.
reviews.comment_grading:
Ivan's grade is quite fair. He follows the guideline printed on the textbook.
Participate more during lectures is highly associated with a better grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
To be honest, quite heavy.
Need to prepare and practice much for vocab test.
If you do not finish homework on time, you may not able to join in the discussion next week.

reviews.author: _ry
reviews.comment_content:
- Happiness
- Beauty

He offered extra materials on classes, such as news articles, to let us have more ideas to complete the assignments.
There are group discussions for almost every lesson, sometimes it may be as long as half an hour but sometimes it could be simply 5 minutes.
reviews.comment_teaching:
He is really friendly. He is willing to answer questions clearly and patiently after class. If you seek help from him and ask for advice on assignments, he is happy to answer you, even if you email him, he will also reply asap.
When it was not discussion time, his class would be a bit boring.
But there were quite a lot of interaction time for students, we always formed groups and wrote some paragraphs.
reviews.comment_grading:
I got a B+ for this course

Writing Task: 6,6,6,6 +1(bonus mark for references)
Speaking Task: 5,5,5,5,4
(with comments)

for ELPA, it is highly consistent with assessment grades
reviews.comment_workload:
workload is average
there are two tasks you have to finish and Bruce seldom gave extra work, if yes, it was usually reading.
preparing for the vocab test took me for around 3 weeks  (score: 33.5/40)
