reviews.author: makmakmakmak
reviews.title: ELPA is the most important thing
reviews.comment_content:
One academic writing task and one speaking. Speaking is divided into two parts, individual speech and group discussion. However, ELPA is the one that make up most of the grade (40%).
In my opinion, this course  would not teach you how to deal with ELPA, except expanding your vocabulary bank.
reviews.comment_teaching: Jan teaches quite well, she likes to move student around for discussion, so that student from different schools can well be mixed. Time flies in her class, as you are being constantly moved around. One thing is that she doesn't like people talking too much or sleeping in her class.
reviews.comment_grading: I did ok in the writing assignment but not too good for the speaking task. I got A- at last since my ELPA has greatly improved compare to the one i did in Fall. I got 7545545666 in the post test. Most of the class got B range so i think you really need to work on ELPA.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is more than that in 1002. She always gives out homework in textbook, and she would go through it in class. If there wasn't enough time, sometimes she would collect it. There is always homework every week, and extra during Friday.

reviews.author: VIRose
reviews.title: Not bad
reviews.comment_content: Same as LANG1002S: Just like all language lessons, following the syllabus. Since you can't choose whether you could take this course, just ignore this part LOL
reviews.comment_teaching: Because of of LANG1002S, I chose Alex again in 1003 HAHA, the comment for him would be the same as my last review for him: He was friendly and would considerate students' opinion on workload or something else, you get it HAHA
reviews.comment_grading:
I got A-
Since the grading of LANG1003 is affected by ELPA, I am not sure about the how is it.
The attendance and participation also counts.
The online feedback for assignments will be deleted after the semester so I will state rough what I got.
Essay 6655
Didn't remember the vocabulary test and speaking assessment
Elpa 65455555
reviews.comment_workload: Light, but need to finish all requirements stated in the syllabus: 3 Vocabulary Tests, get at least 17 or 18 out of 20 questions correct for A range; 1 Long Essay, make sure there is strong logic of the essay and make it coherent; Speaking assessment, 1 group discussion and 1 individual presentation, similar to DSE one, responding and organization of your speech (no matter it is the group one or individual one) are the most important things to grade; ELPA Test.

reviews.author: Kane
reviews.title: Easy course and fair grading
reviews.comment_content:
For Academic blog 2,
it requires
-short summary of 2 articles
-evaluate the 2 articles
-synthesis of 2 articles
-multimodal elements
-strictly follow APA style citation

But the word limit is 400 words only !!!!!!
Therefore I need to reduce the content in the evaluation part and get a 2.5/5 in the CA part.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is normal and will force you to open the camera for attendance. But he is quite nice when answering our question, but for the assignment grading, he didnâ€™t give any comment just about the marks. So even now I am still confusing about what did I do wrong for the assignment.
reviews.comment_grading:
I would say fair grading but I screwed up myself in academic blog 1 so turns out grade B+.

FYI, I am quite active and engaged during his class and answered lot of question.
reviews.comment_workload: I think the workload is quite standard with other instructors and we wonâ€™t have some extra essay to hand in. Cuz I heard from my friend, they need to hand in an extra essay before the academic blog post 1 which is also counting the grade.

reviews.author: Zachary260325
reviews.title: In my opinion, no doubt a bad course
reviews.comment_content: The content is actually weird, from writing blogs to doing a group project. I don't think I actually learned something useful in this course, in this dimension, it's much worse than LANG 1002S.
reviews.comment_teaching: Listening only has little use in your group work and other assignments.
reviews.comment_grading:
Very subjective grading.

If you have a bad instructor, run away, run away, run away!

Your grade has not very much to do with you English skills, or how much effort you put in this course. Our group actually had four meetings on the project, and spent a lot of time working on it, but our instructor just doesn't like our video, and we got a very low score for NO REASON. The instructor didn't give any feedback on what you done good or bad, JUST A SCORE.

I'm very angry about this course, it's the very first B in my university life, I worked hard on every course I took because I dream to get a chance of going abroad and see the world. Then, I got a B for just NO REASON. I spent a lot time on this course, but
actually, NO pay back.

DISGUSTING course.

The only thing you could do, is pray that you won't be prey for a killer instructor.
reviews.comment_workload:
As for me, the workload isn't smaller than a MATH course.

But after I took the course, I found I was an idiot, I could have only done the assignments with the lowest effort. It makes no difference when you are having a killer insturctor. Everything you do seems quite worthless.

reviews.author: chsoai
reviews.comment_content:
The course builds on LANG 1002 and aims to further develop students' proficiency in English as well as their academic literacy skills, so that they can cope with the linguistic demands of studying through the medium of English. The course aims to develop students' competence in reading and writing, as well as the ability to engage in oral interaction in social and academic contexts. For students under the four-year degree curriculum.

Boring content IMO. Also, introverts like me will probably hate this course.
reviews.comment_teaching: Sometimes instructions were unclear but not too bad overall.
reviews.comment_grading: Wouldn't say grading is bad. I really suck at speaking but still managed to get B-.
reviews.comment_workload: Need to write essays and do tons of research, which makes this course somewhat heavy in workload.

reviews.author: HKUST-1
reviews.title: Got killed
reviews.comment_content:
Just a boring English course, you need to keep talking with your classmates, doing some vocab test, writing essays, and doing elpa.

ELPA is special, since this semester is online teaching. So no reading and listening is required, but only writing and speaking, while these 2 are the worst for me. I felt extremely depressed when I got the grade, I don't think getting a C is such easy since I got the similar score in fall semester and I got B-.
reviews.comment_teaching: Good teaching but bad grade. :)
reviews.comment_grading:
Assigned Writing 44540
Vocab learning all full score
vocab test 1 8.5/20
vocab test 2 16/30

C :)
reviews.comment_workload:
Satisfactory, You need to attend the lecture and you can only skip 6 lessons otherwise you will fail the course.

Writing assignment, vocab learning, elpa and vocab test needed.

Heavy for me.

reviews.author: SLL
reviews.comment_content:
This term have two modules:beauty and happiness. Beauty module: need to write at least 600 words (I write about 790) from a topic that you like about beauty. Include topic proposal, outline, and reflective words.
Happiness: group discussion for happiness
reviews.comment_teaching: She is a new teacher here and only teach us since the fifth lesson, due to the delay. She has nice English accents and I understand very well what she is doing. PowerPoint slides are quite informative and give me good ideas and examples on how to finish tasks according to the requirements. Involves discussion in the second half of the semester. Good feedback to the topic proposal and give us some readings about beauty and happiness. Overall, a very nice and caring instructor.
reviews.comment_grading:
Essay proposal, outline, reflection:10%
Essay:20%
Speaking (group discussion):20%
2 Vocab test:15%
Individual vocab learning:5%
Participation:10%
ELPA Speaking and writing:20%
I suspect that the instructor maybe generous in giving marks so the course coordinator need to adjust the grades finally. However, the grades are still good B+.
reviews.comment_workload:
3 Individual vocab learning records
Essay about beauty (at least 600 words) with proposal outline and reflective words
Group discussion+ ELPA speaking
ELPA writing (about 300 words)

reviews.title: Elaine is kind!!!

She tried to involve everyone in class! She will start the lesson by asking everyone "how are you?". Interaction is needed. But in a casual way~
Every lesson will hold a discussion, quite hea, she will ask what hv you discussed.
I think she is nice and she actually motivated me to talk more.

Participation: 10%

Essay writing process: 10%
Vocab test: 5%+10%

group discussion: 20%

Elpa writing: 454 speaking: 4444
Essay: 5455
Writing process: 4/4
parti: 4/4
vocab record: i think if you handed in on time, you will get full mark
Vocab test: 16/20 + 23/30
group discussion : 444
Overall about 78.5, I still got an B+
Luckily elpa only count for 20% in this sem. So I still have a B range lol.
I think she is fair.I have got similar marks in 1002s.
I didn't skip any lesson and i will answer questions only when she ask me to lol
reviews.comment_workload:
One essay about Beauty.
Group discussion about Happiness.
seldom give homework.
the workload is low (i think).
hand in 3 Vocab learning records. ( it is easy, just find 20 vocab and copy the definition n example)
2 Vocab test (ok la)

reviews.author: fxxk
reviews.title: Choosing a good tutor is the key
reviews.comment_content:
Happiness and Beauty
Basic writing skills
Cannot miss more than 5 lessons
reviews.comment_teaching:
LEE, Pui may be the laziest teacher I have ever seen. He just read aloud the textbook page by page.
He simply went through the assignments and you won't know how to do it if you don't ask him.
You will regret to choose him if you want to have a fun class.
OR
You can choose him if you don't want any homework.
reviews.comment_grading:
Elpa (largest)
1 essay
1 group discussion
Two vocabulary tests
Participation (smallest)
reviews.comment_workload:
Similar to LANG 1002
For LEE, Pui's class, no homework or reading materials were assigned by him.

reviews.author: Finger_ha
reviews.title: Easy course and good grade course (if you have chosen the right tutor)
reviews.comment_content:
Two main parts: First half: Beauty; Second half: Happiness

Not too boring, but definitely not the most interesting topics to be taught.

Discussion will be held among students, which is quite often, maybe at least once during every lesson, but no speak up will be forced (at least my tutor did not)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Just choose Mr. Lee if you could and you won't regret.
Teaching is usually quite fun and many interactions between him and the students are quite enough, the grade given by him is pretty good and you could usually get a good grad as long as you have participated in the classes and finished all the assessed tasks.

He is nice and you could always ask for advices for your tests from him.
reviews.comment_grading:
As I said, a good grade course, you can easily get a B+ or even A range as long as you have paid efforts on the assignments and preparation of the ELPA test.

An essay to hand in: 20%
A speaking test: 20%
2 vocal test: (15% in total)
Participation: 5%
ELPA test: 40%
reviews.comment_workload:
An essay to hand in: 5 to 6 paragraph essay of ~800 words on Beauty, need to be handed in Week 7
A speaking test: (Can be prepared at home)
Part 1: Give a 2 min talk to talk about an idea to promote happiness
Part 2: Discuss among your classmates

2 vocal test:
Test 1: Week 5 (test on 40 vocab)
Test 2: Week 11(test on 120 vocab)

ELPA test: 40% (During final period, quite easy for normal students, including Reading, Listening, Writing and Speaking (which Speaking test will be separated from the main ELPA test and be assessed on the other days)

It is the course after LANG1002. Simple topic in all disciplines then relate them to English learning.

Sometimes quite bored but they are easy to manage.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Jim is a local instructor and he really used local teaching style. Forcing you to do a lot of boring stuffs. Listening to him, and not much interactive part except discussion. That's not the best way to learn English for me.

You kind of just sit there and listen to him without doing much in the lesson and it ended.

And you will find he has lot of out of class work which is not compulsory for other instructors. Those works aren't too useful for learning english.
reviews.comment_grading:
Poor grade.

Vocabulary quizzes, essay, quick response, group discussion and attendance. AND ELPA!

I attended all classes, fair result. And got a C grade.
I was in A class in the previous semester and i thought i can get a good grade as I was in S class this semester. Yet, the grade is much poor.
reviews.comment_workload:
Quite heavy workload but you can't get rid of. 3 quizzes, one essay, one two minute response in which you have to prepare for 20 topics and a group discussion. Don't need to worry about ELPA much as you can't really prepare for it. You will get 5 for most part easily.

Out-of-class work as well. You need to do a lot after each class. And you need to submit and discuss it in the next class so it's quite rush if your class is in Monday and Wednesday, like monday work will need to done within a short period of time.

reviews.author: LoLo
reviews.comment_content:
Includes how to write an academic essay and how to communicate with each other efficiently and appropriately.

Syllabus: LANG 1003 is a task-based English language and academic literacy course developed for first-year students. It is the second of two one-semester courses which students take in order to fulfill the Common Core English requirement. The course is designed to increase your language proficiency and equip you with the underlying competence - e.g. thinking critically, discussing, and presenting ideas logically - necessary for you to succeed in English-medium study in tertiary education.
reviews.comment_teaching: Quite responsible and teach us step by step, also patient. She arranged a lot of practice during class, I think it's good.
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair enough.
The final grade is not bad.
reviews.comment_workload:
Assignment: essay and vocabulary. In the end, we have ELPA test.
The essay needs time input, and the talking needs practice. Overall, it's acceptable.

reviews.author: chingyiuviccc
reviews.comment_content: Anna did try her best to deliver her idea in her classes that we have different modes of learning and so we would have different preferences in receiving teaching content. It's brand new if you never know about this idea before, but it would be a little boring when you are familiar with this idea.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Good.
She helped us deal with the assignment and the exam better through the work in class.
She would let us think about the ideas in the essay and ask groupmate for advice and then write it out to receive her feedback.
Also, she would let us have individual speaking and group discussion in order to pass the ELPA speaking test.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grade of my assignments and my exams are general, I  think. Similar grades, 4 or 5 (only once) out of 7.
So I didn't have any expectations on the grade, but surprisingly, I received B+ for this class. Pretty good!
reviews.comment_workload:
Adequate.
Many of the works are just designed to help you to make your essay more structured and developed logically.
At first, I would think it was a little bit heavy, but when I was writing the required essay, I just found it would be pretty easy for me to write under the developed ideas and paragraph structures.

reviews.title: Leng grade even for engine ä»”
reviews.comment_content:
The content is actually quite boring, talking about beauty and happiness as the main 2 topics. The curriculum tries to help you prepare for your assessments, but don't really think it's useful.

Honestly, I don't think I have learnt anything, but it's the problem of the syllabus.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Elaine starts every lectures with a song, then a "How are you?" question for everyone. Just say something rather than "I'm fine" is good enough.

She will sometimes ask you some questions but it's really simple, and I agree that it's quite hea overall. There are discussions in each lesson in small groups, but she doesn't really listen a lot to what you say, but just randomly join the breakout room to see what are you doing and that's it.

However, I will say that she marks the assignment and quizzes bit slow that I got my writing feedback nearly a month after submission. Also, it will be better if she practices and talk more about the ELPA part. Yet, overall I think it's ok!
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading system changed this year in the horrible year of 2020, again! Don't think it's necessary for me to talk about how the grading system works again as you can see below.

As an engineering student, I will say I really frightened at the beginning of the semester as how the rumours said about Elaine, and I tried hard to swap to another sessions (which is obviously unsuccessful, fortunately). In fact, she is quite lenient that my score of the essay is surprisingly much higher than I expected.

Essay: 66661
Writing process: 4/4
Parti: 4/4
Vocab record: 4/4
Vocal test: 11.5/20; 22/30
Speaking: 554
Elpa: 5444444
Finally A-

Probably you will get full mark if you do your vocal record on time. Writing process isn't that difficult as well.

For the parti, I am not those very talkative persons and not that actively answer questions, mainly just give answers when she she asks me. Didn't skip any lessons.

Not high.

Elaine won't give much work for us to do, and if yes, they were only simple little tasks.

An essay about Beauty and I was a deadline fighter.
Writing process is annoying but not hard to do.
4 or 5 vocab records that you only need to copy the definitions and sample sentences of 20 vocals from dictionary.

You may be asked to prepare some info and data for your discussion task, but I don't think it helps a lot.

Hate the 2 vocab tests, like in 1002.

Beauty

reviews.comment_teaching:
Melissa is a good tutor and spoke a nice tone of English. She really made me interested in learning English, which I hated it b4.
She is passionate in teaching and stayed for another 10 minutes after class for students to ask questions.
Before the lesson started, she invited students to play music to relax our mood.
reviews.comment_grading:

I think I get high mark in class participation
Finally, get A-
reviews.comment_workload: Medium since the writing is so chur, but the vocab test is ok tho need revise 120 words in total.

reviews.author: Frankie:)
reviews.title: Very good grade for this semester with nice instructor
reviews.comment_content:
Actually, LANG1003S will only cover topics like Beauty and happiness
Your first writing assignment will be something to do with the beauty, it seems to be a 2-sided argumentative essay with refutation.
The assessed speaking task will be something to do with the happiness,in which you will be arranged into a group of 3 to 4, then discuss with your classmate topics regarding happiness, just relax and perform normally is okay.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Colin is passionate about teaching. Attending his class will be relatively relaxing as he seldom asks you to do the preparation assignment out of the requirements of this course. He will also give leniency to late submission. So,no need to worry about if you cannot catch up with the submission deadline.
But one of the drawbacks of his class is he seldom remind you what is going to happen in the next few lessons. You will only be informed by him a lesson before the Vocab test. So you must stay alert and revise in advance.
Moreover, he seldom releases scores of all assignments, that means you expect some of your scores will remain unknown even after the release of grade
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading of this course of the semester is very good and lenient.There are several assessments for your grade
the writing task
the speaking task(group discussion)
Vocab test 1 (40 words list)
Vocab test 2 (120 words list)
This sem has a special arrangement that epha test has been shortened to comprise of writing(40 minutes,300 words) and speaking(2-minute individual presentation) ONLY

My Performance
Writing Task 55550 out of 77771
Vocab test 1 14/20(highest 18/20)
Vocab test 2 29/30(highest in class)
Shortened Version of epha 6555554
Speaking score and others details not released by Colin
Because of the Killer (Benjamin Leung),i got C+ in LANG 1002A
Final Grade A-  (DSE ENG 45*55*->lv5)
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is fair, not too heavy, not too light. I spent a whole afternoon in writing the first writing assignment (about 800 words,5 paragraphs)And spent about 2-hour practising speaking with friends in Zoom meeting. If you are proficient and good at Engish, you will find this course as a piece of cake.

reviews.author: BLABLAYeah
reviews.title: Good instructor is important
reviews.comment_content: All about wring, speaking and multimodality communication,
reviews.comment_teaching: Doreen is really nice! It is the first time that I am not afraid of the LANG course. She is interesting and friendly, explains the course clearly, and always instructs us step by step.
reviews.comment_grading: I don't know yet. But I can promise that the grading by Doreen will be over the average of overall LANG courses. Even though my SDL is not completed perfectly and thoughtfully; I believe that my grades will not be in the same C range as LANG1002 in the last semester.
reviews.comment_workload: Honestly, it is ok. Just the group project will take some time. If you have nice teammates, this will not be a big deal.
